intro: Chenopodium hircinum f. lonchiphyllum, commonly known as the woolly goosefoot, is a variant of the goosefoot plant characterized by its dense, hairy foliage. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with alternate, heart-shaped leaves covered in fine, white pubescence. It produces small, greenish flowers in clusters, followed by triangular, beak-like fruits. This subspecies is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported diuretic properties.
